nav.div: Salem Public Schools » Families » COVID-19 Updates

h2.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0.167em; border: 0px none; font-family: Rubik; font-weight: 700; color: rgb(64, 99, 152); font-size: 1.2em;

strong.span: Salem Public Schools is closely tracking the 2019 novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak and district leaders, along with city officials, are developing contingency plans and making decisions in accordance with guidance from local, state, and global public health authorities.

Looking for Remote Learning Plans?
Look no further than the Salem Learns Website!

a.title: frequently asked questions opens in a new window
Frequently asked questions in spanish opens in new window

span.strong:
Based on a mandate from Governor Baker, ALL Salem Public Schools will be closed through the end of the school year.
Por mandato del Gobernador Baker, TODAS las Escuelas Públicas de Salem estarán cerradas hasta el final del año escolar.

span.style: font-size: 1.5em; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

div.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap;
position: relative; direction: ltr; font-family: inherit;
font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap;
div.span: As local and state public health experts monitor the outbreak, Salem Public Schools and the building custodians are developing and implementing a set of operational upgrades and daily cleaning plans to maintain our high-standard on routine cleaning, with the addition of enhanced daily cleaning and disinfection of high-contact surfaces like doors, railings, tabletops, light switches, etc.

p.span: Learn more about COVID-19, its symptoms, and available resources on how to keep yourself and your family healthy.
